2012-01-31.abstract: Justice Department says Japanese auto supplier Yazaki agrees to a $470 million fine for engaging in three price-fixing and bid-rigging conspiracies that began as long ago as 2000; four of its executives will serve up to two years in prison; another supplier, Denso Corp, agrees to pay a $78 million fine to settle similar charges.

2012-01-31.abstract: R Allen Stanford and James M Davis were old friends who ran Stanford Financial, but now each blames the other for a $7 billion Ponzi scheme; Davis is chief prosecution witness against Stanford in the case, which could come down to who the jury decides was the mastermind of what prosecutors call an international crime that defrauded nearly 30,000 investors over more than 20 years.
